text: Golf is such a difficult game I've been
playing for decades sometimes I'm not
sure I'm getting any better I might be
getting worse I take lessons I read all
the Golf Magazine's all the Golf books
everything helps and nothing helps
there's got to be something there's got
to be something you can do to improve
your game Bell if you would just go
ahead and set your call behind the ball
and get your address position go into
the PJ learning center in Port st. Lucie
Florida they did a computer imaging of
my swing and an analysis to
they compared me to the greatest swings
in the game in this case that was Sergio
Garcia it wasn't pretty they analyzed my
putting stroke as well not surprisingly
i've got a few problems there too as it
goes back it swings upward very nicely
and makes a beautiful arc through the
ball so the stroke is good in terms of
path it's not good in terms of face
control because you took over with your
hands instead of using your shoulders as
much as you could happen in the end I
learned a lot about my golf swing I like
the game of golf itself the experience
was really humbling but when it comes
down to it Sergio Garcia and I have a
lot in common we're about same size and
neither of us has won a major golf
championship but here we are
side-by-side that Sergio on the right
and my golf club on the left you'll
notice that he's already done swinging
probably walking down the fairway and
i'm still in my backswing but that's the
reality of it isn't it he's one of the
best players in the world a diamond in
the rough with my swing i'm just a guy
in the rough
you
